title: Allow torch.mean to accept a tuple of dimensions
body_html:
🚀 Feature

torch.mean currently only accepts a single dimension. It should also accept a tuple of dimensions like torch.sum does.

Motivation

Makes code cleaner and more concise when taking the mean of some quantity across multiple dimensions. An example of this is taking the mean of some pixel-wise quantity over an image (which has two dimensions, and potentially a color channel).

Alternatives

Current workaround is chaining .means repeatedly, as in array.mean(0).mean(0).mean(0) to take the mean over the first three dimensions of an array.

body:
## 🚀 Feature
`torch.mean` currently only accepts a single dimension. It should also accept a tuple of dimensions like `torch.sum` does.

## Motivation

Makes code cleaner and more concise when taking the mean of some quantity across multiple dimensions. An example of this is taking the mean of some pixel-wise quantity over an image (which has two dimensions, and potentially a color channel).

## Alternatives

Current workaround is chaining `.mean`s repeatedly, as in `array.mean(0).mean(0).mean(0)` to take the mean over the first three dimensions of an array.
